Rater3_text: A few wrong notes were played, and the rhythm was incorrect for a few places.
Rater4_text: Second phrase wasn't played in a different octave.. A lot of hesitancy here and a lot of the quarter notes were too long or short based on when the player was most comfortable with the notes, and a lot of the syncopation was gone because ties were played through or the left hand chords were placed in the wrong place.
Rater5_text: Inconsistent timing and rhythm

Instructor1_text: Pitched are correct but LH rhythms very wrong, added beats in many many measures
Instructor2_text: Careless in counting. Need to count! The piece does not sound even because of the MIScounting!
Instructor3_text: Wrong notes and especially rhythms, throughout.  Notes between hands not lined up correctly.
Instructor4_text: Wrong notes line 2. Wrong rhythm end line 2. Wrong rhythms and notes continue throughout.
Rater1_text: Notes and rhythm were not there! The shape of the song was, but this was also very jarring to listen to. Not enough technical competence to worry about things like shaping melodic lines.
Rater2_text: It does not fit the tempo most of the time.
Rater3_text: The tempo is incorrect. Sometimes more notes are played than written.
Rater4_text: Sometimes the left hand notes were played too early (on the first note of the tie, not the second). This had the notes pretty right, but not entirely and there was no like dynamic variation as written.
Rater5_text: Inconsistent timing and rhythm.

Instructor1_text: Too fast. Dead stops in several places. Pitches, however, are correct.
Instructor2_text: All notes and rhythm are played correctly. But tempo is a bit too fast for the student, hence the starting and stopping. Slow the tempo down, and you can play more accurately.
Instructor3_text: Dynamics not observed.  Slight hesitation page 2.  Tempo a little rushed.
Instructor4_text: Slightly fast.  F/P dynamics not observed. Big hesitations p. lines 2 and 4.
Rater1_text: A good player whose brain stopped halfway through and forgot where their hands should go. Not much to say other than it was perfect aside from the mistakes.
Rater2_text: It has a great start, but sounds not continuous when moving into the second half.
Rater3_text: For a few measures e.g. 11 and 15, the rhythm on the left hand is wrong. The notes are correct.
Rater4_text: The left hand A and F thirds weren't played as written with the rest between them. Right before the D7 notes, the first measure of the second page, you could hear hesitation before playing longer strings of notes. It was too fast and as a result a lot of uncertainty in both the notes and rhythm.
Rater5_text: Nicely done. The performer started off with a steady rhythm and lively expression. There were a few missed notes and hesitations.
